ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Apex is a type of that is either a point that is derived by projecting a conical surface or the common point that is derived by projecting two or more conical surfaces. The from which the Apex is derived are associated with the Apex by the that are specified as the deriving_relationships.

ext_description.p: A Datum_based_length_measure is a dimensional measure of length that is taken from a defined .
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates the usage of a Datum_based_length_measure.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the of_datum specifies the role of the for the Datum_based_length_measure. A is required in order to support equivalent description between the 2d and 3d shape representation cases.

ext_description.p: the measure_orientation specifies the role of the for the Datum_based_length_measure or specifies the role of the string 'normal' or specifies the role of the string 'reversed'. 'Normal' shall be interpreted as a description equivalent to the three dimensional concept of a vector parallel to the normal of the plane that is the datum upon which the Datum_based_length_measure is based. 'Reversed' shall be interpreted as a description equivalent to the three dimensional concept of a vector anti-parallel to the normal of the plane that is the datum upon which the Datum_based_length_measure is based. For the case that the is a , the vector shall be in the XZ plane of the , where the Z axis is the normal vector of the . The measure_orientation is measured from the X axis in the XZ plane. For the two-dimensional case, the if used, is considered to be congruent with the XY coordinate system.
ext_description.note: The use of descriptive items allows the information to be conveyed when the geometric context is 2d, since orientation only supports a description within a 3d geometric context.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the measure specifies the role of the for the Datum_based_length_measure.

ext_description.p: A Datum_difference is a type of . A Datum_difference is the basis for mapping from a geometric context model into a lexical context model for definitional purposes. A Datum_difference identifies the length or angular difference between two . The difference may be referenced independently of the originating geometric model representation.
ext_description.note: One may be located at the origin if a simple location is intended.
The origin reference for a simple angular difference should be the X axis for two-dimensional case, and the XY axis for three-dimesional case.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: a subsequent_datum specifies one role of a for a Datum_difference. The subsequent_datum is the other datum in the Datum_difference.
a precedent_datum specifies one role of a for a Datum_difference. The precedent_datum is the reference datum.
the relation_type inherited from shall be re-declared as a label. The relation_type provides a text identifier for a Datum_difference.

A Datum_difference_based_characteristic is a type of . A Datum_difference_based_characteristic is provided to allow characterization based on a geometric model. This is typically used where there is a reference geometric model available.
an of_datum_difference specifies the role of the for the Datum_difference_based_characteristic.
A Boundary_size_characteristic is either a or an . A Boundary_size_characteristic is a definition that characterizes the size of the .
the maximum_tolerance_value specifies the that represents the maximum size of the . The maximum_tolerance_value need not be specified for the Boundary_size_characteristic.
the tolerance_value specifies the that represents the tolerance size for the Boundary_size_characteristic.

ext_description.p: A Centre_axis is a type of that is axial in form. The from which the Centre_axis is derived are associated with the Centre_axis by the that are specified as the deriving_relationships.
ext_description.note: The attribute deriving_relationships is declared in the entity of which this entity is a subtype.

The precise interpretation of a Centre_axis is context dependent. That is, the distinction is not made between an axis of a feature and a derived median line of a feature as defined in 1.3 of ASME Y14.5M.
ext_description.example: A and a may be applied to the same Centre_axis of a cylindrical .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Centre_of_symmetry is a type of that is derived by determining the geometric centre of one or more . A Centre_of_symmetry is one of a , a , or a .
A Centre_plane is a type of that is planar in form. The derived from the Centre_plane is associated with the Centre_plane by the that are specified as the deriving_relationships.

ext_description.p: A Centre_point is a type of the form of which is that of a point. The from which the Centre_point is derived are associated with the Centre_point by the that are specified as the deriving_relationships.
ext_description.note: The attribute deriving_relationships is declared in the entity of which this entity is a subtype.

ext_description.p: A Composite_linear_profile_refinement_tolerance is a type of that is used in conjunction with a and possibly two other Composite_linear_profile_refinement_tolerance to apply a more restrictive specification on the form, orientation, and possibly size of a than on the location of the . If the Composite_linear_profile_refinement_tolerance is also a the defined is oriented but not located relative to theDatum_system the definition of which is specified as the datum_system_definition.
ext_description.note: The attribute datum_system_definition is declared in theGeometric_tolerance_with_referenced_datum_system entity of which this entity is a subtype.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the refined_control specifies either a or another Composite_linear_profile_refinement_tolerance to which this Composite_linear_profile_refinement_tolerance assists in specifying design requirements by specifying a further refinement of the form, orientation, and possibly size of the specified as the toleranced_shape_element.

ext_description.p: A Composite_surface_profile_refinement_tolerance is a type of that is used in conjunction with a and possibly two other Composite_surface_profile_refinement_tolerance to apply a more restrictive specification on the form, orientation, and possibly size of a than on the location of the . If the Composite_surface_profile_refinement_tolerance is also a the defined is oriented but not located relative to theDatum_system the definition of which is specified as the datum_system_definition.
ext_description.note: The attribute datum_system_definition is declared in theGeometric_tolerance_with_referenced_datum_system entity of which this entity is a subtype.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the refined_control specifies either a or another Composite_surface_profile_refinement_tolerance to which this Composite_surface_profile_refinement_tolerance assists in specifying design requirements by specifying a further refinement of the form, orientation, and possibly size of the specified as the toleranced_shape_element.

A Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary is a type of that is conical in form. The shape of the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary is defined by a frustum the size of which is specified at the surfaces that define the ends of the frustum.

the boundary_and_surface_relationships is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary is dependent on the existence of two that specify the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary as their sized_tolerance_zone_boundary. There shall be exactly two for a Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary.
A Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_and_surface_relationship is a relationship that associates a with one of the two at which the diameter is specified.

the size_characteristic is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_and_surface_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_and_surface_relationship as its .
the terminating_surface specifies the at which the diameter is for the .
the sized_tolerance_zone_boundary specifies the the diameter of which is specified at the specified as the terminating_surface.
A Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_diametrical_size_characteristic is a definition that characterizes the size of a at one of the that defines the ends of the .
the tolerance_value specifies the that represents the diameter of the specified at the specified for the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_diametrical_size_characteristic.

the sized_boundary_at_surface specifies the that associates the with a that defines an end of the at which the size is characterized by the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_diametrical_size_characteristic.

ext_description.p: A Conical_tolerance_zone_definition is a type of the boundary of which is defined by aConical_tolerance_zone_boundary_definition. A Conical_tolerance_zone_definition is defined when it is desired to place a more restrictive specification on one end of a than on the other end.
ext_description.note: Conical tolerance zones are described in 5.8 of ASME Y14.5M.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Curve_dimension is a type ofSingle_boundary_dimension that is measured along the entire path of the characterized the form of which is that of a curve.
A Datum_axis is a type of that is a theoretically exact axis to which toleranced are related.
A Datum_axis_and_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship is a relationship that associates a with the by which it is oriented.

the zone_orientation is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Datum_axis_and_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Datum_axis_and_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship as its .
the orienting_datum_axis specifies the by which the that is specified as the oriented_tolerance_zone is oriented.
the oriented_tolerance_zone specifies the that is oriented with respect to the specified as the orienting_datum_axis.
A Datum_axis_related_orientation is a definition that characterizes the orientation of a in relation to a .

the orientation_type specifies a label that indicates the manner in which the specified is oriented with respect to the specified . The orientation_type shall either be "centred_on_arc", or "centred_on_radial".
the orienting_relationship specifies the that associates the with the with which it is oriented. The specified is characterized by the Datum_axis_related_orientation.
A Datum_based_direction_vector is a characterization of a direction away from and normal to a .

the positive_direction_vector specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the Datum_based_direction_vector is in a positive or negative sense. A value of TRUE indicates that the Datum_based_direction_vector is in the positive sense. A value of FALSE indicates that the Datum_based_direction_vector is in the negative sense.
the vector_of specifies the from which the Datum_based_direction_vector is based.
the direction_vector_representation specifies an that is a representation for the Datum_based_direction_vector.

A Datum_based_vector_orientation is a definition of the orientation of a shape element that has the form of a vector and is based on the intersection of two shape elements that have the form of half-planes. Where a half-plane has the form of a plane except it is bounded on one side by a straight line. Each half-plane shape element is oriented with respect to three and is defined by a .

the direction_components specifies the that defines the half-plane shape elements the intersection of which forms the vector that is defined by the Datum_based_vector_orientation. There shall be exactly two for the Datum_based_vector_orientation.

ext_description.p: A Datum_feature is a type of that is used to establish one or more . A Datum_feature may be a . A Datum_feature may be used to establish one , and one or more .
ext_description.note: The definition of datum feature is given in 3.3 of ISO 5459.

ext_description.p: the identification specifies the label by which the Datum_feature is referred.
ext_description.note: letter identifiers are examples of identifiers of features. The letter identifier is described in 6.1.2 of ISO 5459.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Datum_plane is a type of that is a theoretically exact plane to which toleranced are related.
A Datum_point is a type of that is a theoretically exact point to which toleranced are related. A Datum_point may be a .
the associated_3d_shape_intersection specifies the for the Datum_point. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the location_in_3d specifies the for the Datum_point. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the location_in_2d specifies the for the Datum_point. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Datum_target_set is a type of that is composed of one or more .

the included_datum_targets is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Datum_target_set is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Datum_target_set as its . There shall be one or more for the Datum_target_set.
A Datum_target_usage_in_datum_target_set_relationship is a relationship that associates a with a that the participates in defining.

ext_description.p: the datum_target_number specifies the positive integer that identifies the usage of the in the definition of a for the Datum_target_usage_in_datum_target_set_relationship.
ext_description.note: The datum target number is described in 7.1.1 of ISO 5459.

ext_description.p: the used_datum_target specifies the that is used to define the specified as the defined_datum_target_set for the Datum_target_usage_in_datum_target_set_relationship.
ext_description.note: Since a may be used to define multiple Datum_target_sets and the number may be different depending on the that the participates in defining, the datum_target_number is assigned to the Datum_target_usage_in_datum_target_set_relationship rather than on the .
ext_description.example: A datum target is used to define datum target sets A and G. The usage of the datum target in the definition of datum target set A is assigned a datum target number of 3. The usage of the datum target in defining datum target set G is assigned a datum target number of 1. This situation would be represented by a single instance of , two instances of , and two instances of Datum_target_usage_in_datum_target_set_relationship. The instances of would be assigned the identifications of "A" and "G". The instances of Datum_target_usage_in_datum_target_set_relationship that associate the instance of to the instances of identified as "A" and "G" would have datum_target_number values of 3 and 1, respectively.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the defined_datum_target_set specifies the in which the specified participates in defining.
A Derived_shape_element is a type of that is derived from a set of one or more other . A Derived_shape_element is one of an , a , a , a , a , or a .

ext_description.p: the deriving_relationships is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Derived_shape_element is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Derived_shape_element as its . There shall be one or more specified as the deriving_relationships for a Derived_shape_element.
ext_description.example: The of a cylindrical hole is a Derived_shape_element. The cannot exist unless the hole exists.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Shape_element_deriving_relationship is a type of that associates a with a from which the is derived.
the relating specifies the that is the that is derived from the specified as the related_shape_element for the Shape_element_deriving_relationship.
A Diametrical_boundary_size_characteristic is a type of that defines the diameter of a .
the sized_boundary specifies the , the diameter of which is defined by the Diametrical_boundary_size_characteristic.

ext_description.p: A Dimension_qualifier is either a or a . A Dimension_qualifier is a description that qualifies one or more .
ext_description.note: Qualifying notes are described in 5.3 of ISO/DIS 1101.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the qualified_dimensions specifies the to which the Dimension_qualifier applies. There shall be one or more specified as the qualified_dimensions for a Dimension_qualifier. There shall be one or more for each qualitifed_dimensions.

A Dimension_related_positional_boundary is a type of that is a theoretical boundary that is composed of a set of one or more . Each is defined by a separateBoundary_based_position_tolerance in conjunction with a .
the constrained_physical_feature specifies the that is to be constrained by the Dimension_related_positional_boundary.
the boundary_members specifies the that comprise the Dimension_related_positional_boundary. There shall be one or more specified as the boundary_members for the Dimension_related_positional_boundary.
A Dimension_related_positional_boundary_definition is a type of that characterizes a .

the characterized_boundary_member_definitions specifies the that characterize each that comprise the . There shall be one or more specified as the characterized_boundary_member_definitions for the Dimension_related_positional_boundary_definition.
the defined_positional_boundary specifies the that is characterized by the Dimension_related_positional_boundary_definition.
A Dimension_set is a set of that specify the theoretically exact shape of a .
the associated_dimensions specifies the that are associated with the Dimension_set. There shall be one or more specified as the associated_dimensions for the Dimension_set.
A Dimensional_characteristic_representation is an association between a and the that represents the .

ext_description.p: the auxiliary_dimension_representation specifies the boolean value that indicates whether the associated is to be considered a requirement for the associated or is specified for informational purposes only. A value of TRUE indicates that the associated is for informational purposes only. A value of FALSE indicates that the associated is to be considered a requirement.
ext_description.note: Auxiliary dimension is defined in 3.1.1.3 of ISO 129.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the dimension specifies either a or a that is represented by the specified for the Dimensional_characteristic_representation.
the representation specifies the that represents the specified for the Dimensional_characteristic_representation.
A Dimensional_size_based_on_opposing_boundaries is a type of that characterizes the size of a as well as characterizing the relationship between two opposing from which the is composed.

ext_description.p: the is_applied_to specifies the for which the size is characterized by the Dimensional_size_based_on_opposing_boundaries.
ext_description.note: The attribute is_applied_to is declared in the entity of which this entity is a subtype.
ext_description.example: The size of a that consists of two opposing surfaces of a notch would be characterized by a Dimensional_size_based_on_opposing_boundaries.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the boundary_separation specifies the that specifies the two Shape_elements that are on the boundary of the for which the separation is characterized by the Dimensional_size_based_on_opposing_boundaries and is the basis for the size of the .

A Directed_axis is a type of that is an axis in which a direction is defined. A Directed_axis is defined by a base , with which the Directed_axis is congruent, and two through which the base passes or would pass if the Shape_elements were extended. One of the two Shape_elements is specified as the start_shape_element and the other one specified as the end_shape_element.

the end_shape_element specifies the through which the Directed_axis passes or would pass if the were extended. The specified by the end_shape_element is in the positive direction from the specified by the start_shape_element.

the start_shape_element specifies the through which the Directed_axis passes or would pass if the were extended. The specified by the start_shape_element is in the negative direction from the specified by the end_shape_element.
the axis_to_be_oriented specifies the that serves as a base axis by which the Directed_axis is defined.

A Direction_element is a definition of a shape element that has the form of a half-plane and is used in conjunction with the definition of another half-plane shape element to define a . In this instance a half-plane has the form of a plane except it is bounded on one side by a straight line. The half-plane shape element that the Direction_element defines is oriented with respect to three .

the elements_of is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Direction_element is dependent on the existence of one or more that specifies the Direction_element as one of their direction_components.
the direction_of_half_datum_plane specifies the of a that intersects the base and indicates the half of the base from which the half-plane shape element defined by the Direction_element is oriented.
the base_datum_plane specifies the from which the half-plane shape element defined by the Direction_element is oriented.
the angle_value specifies the that represents the magnitude of the angle between the half-plane shape element defined by the Direction_element and half of the specified as the base_datum_plane.

the direction specifies the that defines the orientation of the angle between the half-plane shape element defined by the Direction_element and half of the specified by the base_datum_plane. The angle is measured from half of the base to the defined half-plane shape element in a clockwise direction when viewed in the direction of the .

An Edge_segment_vertex is a type of and . An Edge_segment_vertex supports explicit assignment of the order and connection of edge start and end points but without needing to use an explicit geometric or topological context.
An Externally_defined_dimension_representation is a type of the interpretation of which is dependent on definitions supported externally to this part of ISO 10303.
the definitions specify the that represents the . There shall be one or more specified as definitions for an Externally_defined_dimension_representation.

ext_description.p: the dimension_value specifies the that in conjunction with the , that are specified as the definitions, represent the associated . The dimension_value need not be specified for an Externally_defined_dimension_representation.
ext_description.example: The system of limits and fits specifies a way in which to represent dimensions and is defined in ISO 286.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Geometric_alignment is a type of that is a linear or planar that is established to contain two or more aligned . The from which the Geometric_alignment is established are associated with the Geometric_alignment by the that are specified as the deriving_relationships.

A Geometric_intersection is a type of that is the common intersection of two or more . The from which the Geometric_intersection is derived are associated with the Geometric_intersection by the that are specified as the deriving_relationships.

ext_description.p: A Geometric_tolerance_qualifier is either a or a . A Geometric_tolerance_qualifier is a description that qualifies one or more .
ext_description.note: Qualifying notes are described in 5.3 of ISO/DIS 1101.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the qualified_geometric_tolerances specifies the to which the Geometric_tolerance_qualifier applies. There shall be one or more for a Geometric_tolerance_qualifier.

A Geometric_tolerance_with_applied_material_condition_property is a type of that specifies or partially specifies the design requirement on one or more geometric characteristics of the toleranced in which the restrictiveness of the requirement is dependent on the actual size of the produced or the actual size of the produced from which the toleranced is derived. A Geometric_tolerance_with_applied_material_condition_property in which the applied_material_condition_property_name is "maximum_material_principle" participates in specifying a requirement that is less stringent as the produced deviates from its maximum material condition towards its least material condition. In this case, the specified size of the is the base size from which it is increased by the amount the produced deviates from its maximum material condition towards its least material condition. A Geometric_tolerance_with_applied_material_condition_property in which the applied_material_condition_property_name is "least_material_requirement" participates in specifying a requirement that is less stringent as the produced deviates from its least material condition towards its maximum material condition. In this case the specified size of the is the base size from which it is increased by the amount the produced deviates from its least material condition towards its maximum material condition. A Geometric_tolerance_with_applied_material_condition_property may be aBoundary_based_position_tolerance.

the applied_material_condition_property_name specifies the for the Geometric_tolerance_with_applied_material_condition_property. The applied_material_condition_property_name specifies the type of the applied material condition property, either "least_material_requirement" or "maximum_material_principle" for the Geometric_tolerance_with_applied_material_condition_property.
A Limit_dimension_representation is a type of that explicitly describes the maximum and minimum limits of one or more .
the lower_dimension_value specifies the that describes the minimum limit of the for which the Limit_dimension_representation is a representation.
the upper_dimension_value specifies the that describes the maximum limit of the for which the Limit_dimension_representation is a representation.

A Linear_extension is a type of that is derived by linearly extending a that is a curve or surface. The of which the Linear_extension is an extension is associated with the Linear_extension by the that are specified as the deriving_relationships.

A Maximum_dimension_representation is a type of that explicitly describes the maximum limit of one or more and in which the minimum limit is not specified as it is determined by other elements of the design.

A Minimum_dimension_representation is a type of that explicitly describes the minimum limit of one or more and in which the maximum limit is not specified as it is determined by other elements of the design.
An Opposing_boundary_set_size_characteristic is a type of that defines the distance between the two members of a . The two members may or may not be explicitly identified.
the sized_boundary_set specifies the of which the distance between its two members is defined by the Opposing_boundary_set_size_characteristic.

A Parallel_shape_element_relationship is a type of that asserts that two are parallel to each other. One is specified as the related_shape_element and the other is specified as the relating_shape_element.

ext_description.p: A Perpendicular_shape_element_relationship is a type of that asserts that two are perpendicular to each other. One is specified as the related_shape_element and the other is specified as the relating_shape_element.
ext_description.note: The attribute related_shape_element is declared in the entity of which this entity is a subtype.
The attribute relating_shape_element is declared in the entity of which this entity is a subtype.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Positional_boundary is a type of that is a theoretical boundary that is defined by aBoundary_based_position_tolerance. The theoretical boundary is a boundary that cannot be intruded upon by the toleranced if the is an internal (e.g., a hole) and the Boundary_based_position_tolerance is applied on a "maximum material principle" basis, or if the toleranced is an external (e.g., a tab) and the Boundary_based_position_tolerance is applied on a "least material requirement" basis. Additionally, the theoretical boundary is a boundary that cannot be escaped by the toleranced if the is an internal and the Boundary_based_position_tolerance is applied on a "least material requirement" basis, or if the toleranced is an external and the Boundary_based_position_tolerance is applied on a "maximum material principle" basis. A Positional_boundary is either a or a .
the boundary_definition is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Positional_boundary as its .
A Positional_boundary_and_profile_boundary_member_relationship is a relationship that associates a with the from which the is offset.

the offset is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary_and_profile_boundary_member_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Positional_boundary_and_profile_boundary_member_relationship as its .
the base_profile_tolerance_zone_boundary_member specifies the from which the specified as the offset_positional_boundary is offset.
the offset_positional_boundary specifies the that is offset from the that is specified as the base_profile_tolerance_zone_boundary_member.
A Positional_boundary_definition is a definition that characterizes a . A Positional_boundary_definition is either a or a .
the defined_positional_boundary specifies the that is characterized by the Positional_boundary_definition.
A Positional_boundary_member is a type of that is a member of a . A Positional_boundary_member is defined by aBoundary_based_position_tolerance in conjunction with a .

the boundary_member_definition is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary_member is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Positional_boundary_member as its .

the composed_positional_boundary is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary_member is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Positional_boundary_member as one of its boundary_members.

A Positional_boundary_member_definition is a definition that characterizes a . Each Positional_boundary_member_definition is defined by aBoundary_based_position_tolerance in conjunction with a . The shape of the is identical to that of the toleranced . However, the size of the is based on the associated , the material conditions specified by the associated Boundary_based_position_tolerance, and whether the toleranced is an internal (e.g., a pair of opposing slot sides) or an external (e.g., a pair of opposing tab sides) .

the boundary_definition is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary_member_definition is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Positional_boundary_member_definition as one of its characterized_boundary_member_definitions.

the associated_dimension specifies the that defines the maximum material size and minimum material size of the toleranced . If the associatedBoundary_based_position_tolerance is specified on a "maximum material principle" basis, the maximum material size is used as the base size to which the specified as the tolerance_value is subtracted if the toleranced is an internal , or added if the toleranced is an external . If the associated Boundary_based_position_tolerance is specified on a "least material requirement" basis, the least material size is used as the base size to which the specified as the tolerance_value is added if the toleranced is an internal , or subtracted if the toleranced is an external .

the tolerance_value specifies the that represents the amount the size of the is reduced or enlarged from the base size that is determined by the associated and the material condition specified by the associatedBoundary_based_position_tolerance.
the defined_positional_boundary_member specifies the that is characterized by the Positional_boundary_member_definition.
A Positional_boundary_offset is a definition that characterizes the offset of a from a .

the boundary_definition is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary_offset is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Positional_boundary_offset as its .
the tolerance_value specifies the for the Positional_boundary_offset. The associated is offset from the associated by half the distance specified by the tolerance_value.
the offset_boundary_relationship specifies the that associates the with the from which it is offset, and which is characterized by the Positional_boundary_offset.
A Pre_defined_dimension_qualifier is a type of the intent of which is unambiguous and is commonly used in geometric dimensioning.

the description specifies the label that describes the manner in which the that are specified as the qualified_dimensions are qualified by the Pre_defined_dimension_qualifier. The description shall be either "average", or "free_state".
A Pre_defined_geometric_tolerance_qualifier is a type of the intent of which is unambiguous and is commonly used in geometric tolerancing.

the description specifies the label that describes the manner in which the that are specified as the qualified_geometric_tolerances are qualified by the Pre_defined_geometric_tolerance_qualifier. The description shall be either "each_element", "each_radial_element", "free_state", "major_diameter", "minor_diameter", "not_concave", "not_convex", or "pitch_diameter".

A Profile_of_any_line_tolerance_without_referenced_datum_system is a type ofGeometric_tolerance_without_referenced_datum_system and a type of in which the line elements of the toleranced are not oriented and/or located in relation to aDatum_system. That is, it is a that specifies design requirements on the profile of line elements of the to which the Profile_of_any_line_tolerance_without_referenced_datum_system is applied, and in which the line elements are oriented parallel to a specified as opposed to oriented relative to a referenced Datum_system.

A Profile_related_positional_boundary is a type of that is a theoretical boundary that is defined by aBoundary_based_position_tolerance in conjunction with a . The defines a that is bounded by two . The Profile_related_positional_boundary is offset from one of these . The particular and the direction of offset are determined by the material conditions specified by the Boundary_based_position_tolerance. If the Boundary_based_position_tolerance is specified on a "maximum material principle" basis, then the from which the Profile_related_positional_boundary is offset is the one that is offset from the "away from material". Similarly, if the Boundary_based_position_tolerance is specified on a "least material requirement" basis, then the from which the Profile_related_positional_boundary is offset is the one that is offset from the "towards material". The Profile_related_positional_boundary is offset from the in the same direction that the is offset from the .

the associating_relationship is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Profile_related_positional_boundary is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Profile_related_positional_boundary as its .

A Profile_related_positional_boundary_definition is a type of that characterizes a . A Profile_related_positional_boundary_definition is defined by aBoundary_based_position_tolerance in conjunction with a .
the boundary_offset specifies the that characterizes the offset of the for the Profile_related_positional_boundary_definition.
the defined_positional_boundary specifies the that is characterized by the Profile_related_positional_boundary_definition.
A Projected_zone_and_base_relationship is a relationship that associates a with the from which the is projected.

the size_characteristic is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Projected_zone_and_base_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Projected_zone_and_base_relationship as its .
the projected_zone specifies the that is projected from the that is specified as the base_physical_feature.
the base_physical_feature specifies the from which the that is specified as the projected_zone is projected.
A Projected_zone_height_characteristic is a definition that characterizes the height that a is projected from a .
the projected_height_value specifies the that represents the height that the associated is projected relative to the associated for the Projected_zone_height_characteristic.
the defined_height_of specifies the that associates a with the from which the is projected. The specified is characterized by the Projected_zone_height_characteristic.

A Restraint_condition is the specification of a requirement on the restraining conditions applied either to a or a during the verification of one or more or . The Restraint_condition may be a . If the Restraint_condition is not a , the Restraint_condition is a requirement for all instances of and with the exception of those instances of that have a applied to them that have a description of "FREE_STATE", and those instances of that have a applied to them that have a description of "FREE_STATE".

the applied_to specifies either a or aDatum_feature_usage_in_datum_relationship. If the applied to specifies a , it is on that that the restraint requirement is applied. If a Datum_feature_usage_in_datum_relationship is specified as the applied_to, the Restraint_condition specifies a restraint requirement on the relationship between the and the specified by the Datum_feature_usage_in_datum_relationship.

ext_description.p: A Runout_tolerance_zone_definition_with_specified_angle is a type of that is defined by either a or a , and in which the is oriented with respect to a . The is coincident with the about which the is centred.
ext_description.note: Circular run-out tolerance in a specified direction is described in 14.13.4 of ISO 1101.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the runout_orientation specifies the that defines the orientation of the relative to a specified for the Runout_tolerance_zone_definition_with_specified_angle.
A Runout_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship is a relationship that associates a with the with which it is oriented.

the angular_size_characteristic is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Runout_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Runout_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship as its .
the orienting_axis specifies the to which the specified is oriented by the Runout_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship.
the oriented_zone specifies the that is oriented with respect to the specified by the Runout_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship.
A Runout_zone_orientation is a definition that characterizes the orientation between a and a that is coincident with the about which the is centred.

the zone_definition is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Runout_zone_orientation is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Runout_zone_orientation as its .
the semi_angle_value specifies the that represents the size of the angle between the and the .
the oriented_relationship specifies the that associates the with the with which the is oriented, and that is characterized by the Runout_zone_orientation.

ext_description.p: A Separate_geometric_tolerance_requirement is a specification that indicates that a set of one or moreGeometric_tolerance_with_referenced_datum_system is to be treated as a separate requirement. That is, when geometric tolerances (excluding the composite profile refinement tolerances and composite feature relating position tolerances) reference the same datum system, all the physical features to which the geometric tolerances are applied are treated as a single pattern with regard to the geometric tolerances. If this type of interrelationship is not desired, the Separate_geometric_tolerance_requirement may be used to specify a set of one or more that are to be treated as a separate requirement.
ext_description.note: Separate requirements are discussed in 4.5.12 of ASME Y14.5M.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the separated_geometric_tolerances specifies theGeometric_tolerance_with_referenced_datum_system that are to be treated as a separate requirement. There shall be one or more Geometric_tolerances_with_referenced_datum_system for a Separate_geometric_tolerance_requirement.

A Shape_dimension_representation is one of an , a , a , or a . A Shape_dimension_representation is a representation of a . The Shape_dimension_representation explicitly describes one or more with a single value, a range of values, a combination of values, or values and references to the standard documents that define the meaning of these values.

ext_description.p: A Simultaneous_geometric_tolerance_requirement is a specification that a set of two or more is to be treated as a simultaneous requirement. That is, the shape elements to which composite profile refinement tolerances and composite feature relating position tolerances are applied are treated as separate shape elements with regard to the geometric tolerances. If this type of independence is not desired, the Simultaneous_geometric_tolerance_requirement may be used to specify a set of two or more that are to be treated as a simultaneous requirement.
ext_description.note: Simultaneous requirements are discussed in 4.5.12.1 of ASME Y14.5M.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the grouped_geometric_tolerances specifies the that are to be treated as a simultaneous requirement. There shall be two or more for a Simultaneous_geometric_tolerance_requirement.
A Singular_dimension_representation is a type of that explicitly describes one or more with a single value. A Singular_dimension_representation is one of a , a , or a .
the dimension_value specifies the that describes the for which the Singular_dimension_representation is a representation.

A Statistical_dimensional_tolerance is a type of that specifies design requirements that are based on sound statistics. Associated with the Statistical_dimensional_tolerance is the requirement that a specified level of process control be maintained during the manufacture of the . A Statistical_dimensional_tolerance may specify another as an alternate to the Statistical_dimensional_tolerance in the event that the specified level of process control cannot be met.

the alternate_dimension specifies the that shall be used if the specified level of process control cannot be met. The alternate_dimension need not be specified for a Statistical_dimensional_tolerance.

A Statistical_geometric_tolerance is a type of that specifies design requirements that are based on sound statistics. Associated with the Statistical_geometric_tolerance is the requirement that a specified level of process control be maintained during the manufacture of the . A Statistical_geometric_tolerance may specify another as an alternate to the Statistical_geometric_tolerance in the event that the specified level of process control cannot be met.
the alternate_tolerance specifies the that shall be used if the specified level of process control cannot be met. The alternate_tolerance need not be specified for a Statistical_geometric_tolerance.

ext_description.p: A Tangent_plane is a type of that is planar in form.
ext_description.example: An might be applied to the Tangent_plane derived from a surface of a , as opposed to the surface itself, if variations in the form of the surface are unimportant or are sufficiently constrained by other tolerances.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Tangent_shape_element is a type of that is either a straight line that contacts a curve at only the high points or is a plane that contacts a surface at only its high points. The from which the Tangent_shape_element is derived is associated with the Tangent_shape_element by the that is specified as the deriving_relationships. A Tangent_shape_element may be a .
A Theoretically_exact_dimension_representation is a type of that describes the theoretically exact size, form, orientation, or location of one or more .
The Tolerance_specific_restraint_condition is a type of that is only applied to specified instances of and .
the affected_tolerances specifies the and to which the restraint condition applies. There shall be one or more or specified as the affected_tolerances by a Tolerance_specific_restraint_condition.
A Tolerance_zone_and_viewing_plane_orienting_relationship is a relationship that associates a with the by which it is oriented.

the zone_orientation is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Tolerance_zone_and_viewing_plane_orienting_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Tolerance_zone_and_viewing_plane_orienting_relationship as its .
the oriented_tolerance_zone specifies the that is oriented with respect to the specified as the orienting_viewing_plane.
the orienting_viewing_plane specifies the by which the that is specified as the oriented_tolerance_zone is oriented.

ext_description.p: A Tolerance_zone_boundary is a type of that is a boundary of a . A Tolerance_zone_boundary is one of a , a , or a .
ext_description.example: A pair of opposing planes may form a Tolerance_zone_boundary.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Tolerance_zone_boundary_member is a type of that is one of the two explicitly identified members of a .

ext_description.p: the explicit_opposing_boundary_set is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Tolerance_zone_boundary_member is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Tolerance_zone_boundary_member as one of its boundary_members.
ext_description.example: Tolerance_zone_boundary_members may be used to specify an unequally disposed profile tolerance (i.e., either a or ).

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Tolerance_zone_boundary_member_offset is a definition that characterizes the size and direction that a is offset from the of the toleranced .
the type_of_offset specifies a label that indicates the direction that the is offset from the . The type_of_offset shall either be "away_from_material" or "towards_material".
the offset_value specifies the that represents distance the is offset from the .
the offset_tolerance_zone_boundary_member specifies the the offset of which is characterized by the Tolerance_zone_boundary_member_offset.

A Tolerance_zone_circular_or_cylindrical_or_spherical_boundary is a type of that is circular, cylindrical, or spherical in form. The actual form of the is dictated by the type of tolerance and the form of the toleranced .

ext_description.p: a size_characteristic is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Tolerance_zone_circular_or_cylindrical_or_spherical_boundary is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Tolerance_zone_circular_or_cylindrical_or_spherical_boundary as its .
ext_description.example: A cylindrical could be defined by a position tolerance applied to an axis of a cylindrical hole.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Tolerance_zone_with_per_unit_size_specification is a type of in which the extent of the is defined. A Tolerance_zone_with_per_unit_size_specification is used to define a when the design requirements are such that abrupt variations in the toleranced must be limited. In essence, the thickness, or the diameter, of the is defined by the and the extent is defined by the . Each element of the toleranced that has the same extent as the must lie within the when the is positioned coincident with the element.
the per_unit_size_specification specifies the that defines the extent of the specified for the Tolerance_zone_definition_with_per_unit_size_specification.
A Tolerance_zone_definition_with_specified_orientation is a type of in which the orientation of the is specified.
the zone_orientation specifies either a , a , or a for the Tolerance_zone_definition_with_specified_orientation.
A Tolerance_zone_explicit_opposing_boundary_set is a type of in which the two opposing boundary members are explicitly identified.

the boundary_members specify the that comprise the Tolerance_zone_explicit_opposing_boundary_set. There shall be exactly two Tolerance_zone_boundary_members specified as boundary_members for a Tolerance_zone_explicit_opposing_boundary_set.
A Tolerance_zone_form is a definition that characterizes of the form of the .
the name specifies the identifying label of the Tolerance_zone_form.
the characterized_tolerance_zone specifies the for which the Tolerance_zone_form is defined.
A Tolerance_zone_implicit_opposing_boundary_set is a type of in which the two opposing boundary members are not explicitly identified.

A Tolerance_zone_opposing_boundary_set is a type of that consists of a set of two like boundary members that are separated by a constant distance. A Tolerance_zone_opposing_boundary_set is either a or a .

ext_description.p: the size_characteristic is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Tolerance_zone_opposing_boundary_set is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Tolerance_zone_opposing_boundary_set as its .
ext_description.example: Two opposing planes comprise the Tolerance_zone_boundary_set that is defined when a is applied to the top surface of a printed circuit board. The size_characteristic specifies the separation between the two opposing planes.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Tolerance_zone_per_unit_size_specification is a specification of the that defines the extent of the .

the zone_definition is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Tolerance_zone_per_unit_size_specification is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Tolerance_zone_per_unit_size_specification as its .
the specified_tolerance_zone specifies the the extent of which is defined by the Tolerance_zone_per_unit_size_specification.
A True_profile is a definition that characterizes the theoretically exact shape of a .
the profile_representation specifies one of a , a , an , or a that represents the True_profile.
the profiled_surface specifies the that is characterized by the True_profile
A User_defined_dimension_qualifier is a type of that requires a more detailed description than those stated for a .
the name specifies the label for the User_defined_dimension_qualifier by which it is referred.
the description specifies the text that describes the manner in which the that are specified as the qualified_dimensions are qualified by the User_defined_dimension_qualifier.
A User_defined_geometric_tolerance_qualifier is a type of that requires a more detailed description than those stated for a .
the name specifies the label for the User_defined_geometric_tolerance_qualifier by which it is referred.
the description specifies the text that describes the manner in which the that are specified as the qualified_geometric_tolerances are qualified by the User_defined_geometric_tolerance_qualifier.
A Viewing_plane is a type of that is a plane to which a is oriented.
a viewing_plane_specification is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Viewing_plane is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Viewing_plane as its .
A Viewing_plane_definition is a definition that characterizes a .

the zone_orientation is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Viewing_plane_definition is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Viewing_plane_definition as its .
the viewing_plane_representation specifies the that characterizes the for the Viewing_plane_definition.
the defined_viewing_plane specifies the that is characterized by the Viewing_plane_definition, and with which the specified is oriented.
A Viewing_plane_based_orientation is a definition that characterizes the orientation of a with respect to a .
the viewing_plane_specification specifies a that characterizes the with which the is oriented.
the orienting_relationship specifies the that associates the with the with which it is oriented.
